page.title: 03Christow Primary School cont
page.content: On 16th December 1948 the village school at Bridford closed and the 12 children in attendance at the time were transported to Christow. Christow is still the catchment school for the children of Bridford after 37 years. At present there are 75 children on roll, a headteacher and two assistant full-time teachers and one part-time teacher. Class 1 has 19 children, Class 2 has 28 and Class 3 has 28 also. The children start school the term in which they are 5 and leave at 11 years. Most transfer to the comprehensive school at Kingsteignton and a few to other private schools in the vicinity.
